text: Bloody Sunday was a day of violence in Dublin, Ireland, United Kingdom, on 21 November 1920. It happened during the Irish War of Independence. In total, 31 people were killed. This included fourteen British people, fourteen Irish civilians and three republican prisoners. There are quite a lot of events known as Bloody Sunday. ==Other websites== * Category:1920 in the United Kingdom Category:1920s in Ireland Category:20th century in Dublin Category:Irish War of Independence Category:Massacres in Europe Category:Police misconduct
title: Bloody Sunday (1920)
